oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Magnetic-properties of 2 new compounds - GD2NI3SI5 and SM2NI3SI5
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAZUMDAR, C
NAGARAJAN, R
GUPTA, LC
VIJAYARAGHAVAN, R
GODART, C
PADALIA, BD
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ce2ni3si5
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The formation of two new materials, SM2Ni3Si5 and Gd2Ni3Si5, of the rare-earth series R2M3Si5 (R denotes rare earth and Y) and their magnetic and transport properties are reported here. These materials crystallize in the orthorhombic U2Co3Si5-type structure (space group Ibam). The magnetic susceptibility of Gd2Ni3Si5 follows a Curie-Weiss behavior with an effective magnetic moment 8.1mu(B)/Gd ion. The material orders antiferromagnetically at almost-equal-to 15 K. The magnetic susceptibility of Sm2Ni3Si5 exhibits a deviation from the Curie-Weiss behavior which is attributed to the low-lying excited state of Sm3+ ions and also to crystal-field effects. This material also orders antiferromagnetically, but at almost-equal-to 11 K. This value of the ordering temperature does not seem to follow the de Gennes scaling with respect to that of Gd
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 38th Annual Conference on Magnetism and Magnetic Materials (MMM 93),MINNEAPOLIS, MN,NOV 15-18, 1993
